the use of closure

11 Nov 2013

make flag or counter structure more clean

normally, we use counter or flag as this:

    var flag = false;
    function turnTrue(){
        return flag = true;
    }
    function turnFalse(){
        return flag = false;
    }

or: ```javascript

var flag = false;
function turnTrue(){
    return flag = !flag;
}

then, we can use closure to make it more structive:

```javascript

    function makeTurnBooln(){
        var flag = false;
        return function(){
            return flag = !flag;
        }
    }
    var turnBooln = makeTurnBooln();
    turnBooln() // true
    turnBooln() // false
    turnBooln() // true

or:

    function makeTurnObj(){
        var flag = false;
        return {
            turnTrue : function(){
                return flag = true;
            },

            turnFalse : function(){
                return flag = false;
            }
        }
    }

    var turnBoolnObj = makeTurnObj();   
    turnBoolnObj.turnTure()  // true
    turnBoolnObj.turnFalse()  // false
object pattern compare to closure pattern:
    makeTurnObj = {
        flag : false,

        turnTrue : function(){
            return flag = true;
        },

        turnFalse : function(){
            return flag = false;
        }

    }

    makeTurnObj.turnTure()  // true
    makeTurnObj.turnFalse()  // false
